_header: These old gentle Bretons in their days
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Franklin’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 20 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
These oolde gentil bretons in her dayesof dyuerse auentures maden
                    layes…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…my spirit felith nought of suche materebut if yow list my
                    tale shul ye hire
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwyng bigynneth the ffrankelyns prologe (f.
                        249v); the ffrankeleyne (RT); Here endith the ffrankeleyne his
                    prolog… (f. 249v)
